item.title: Oscar add a quote by Juan Felipe Herrera
item.description: "Your friends, and your associates, and the people around you, and the environment that you live in, and the speakers around you - the speakers around you - and the communicators around you, are the poetry makers. If your mother tells you stories, she is a poetry maker. If your father says stories, he is a poetry maker. If your grandma tells you stories, she is a poetry maker. And that’s who forms our poetics." -- Juan Felipe Herrera

item.title: Oscar add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "This is the city, and I am one of the citizens/Whatever interests the rest interests me" -- Walt Whitman

item.title: Oscar add a quote by Gustavo Pérez Firmat
item.description: "The fact that I am writing to you in English already falsifies what I wanted to tell you. My subject: how to explain to you that I don't belong to English though I belong nowhere else, if not here in English." -- Gustavo Pérez Firmat

item.title: Oscar add a quote by Chuck D
item.description: "Most of my heroes don't appear on no stamps" -- Chuck D

item.title: Oscar add a quote by William Carlos Williams
item.description: "If it ain't a pleasure, it ain't a poem." -- William Carlos Williams

item.title: Oscar add a quote by Martin Espada
item.description: "Even the most political poem is an act of faith." -- Martin Espada

item.title: Oscar add a quote by Willie Perdomo
item.description: "This is definitely / for the brothers / who ain't here." -- Willie Perdomo

item.title: Oscar add a quote by Suheir Hammad
item.description: "Your war drum ain't / louder than this breath." -- Suheir Hammad

item.title: Oscar add a quote by Gabriela Mistral
item.description: "You shall create beauty not to excite the senses but to give sustenance to the soul. " -- Gabriela Mistral

item.title: Oscar add a quote by Julia de Burgos
item.description: "Yo, múltiple, como en contradicción" -- Julia de Burgos

item.title: Oscar add a quote by Audre Lorde
item.description: "I have come to believe over and over again that what is most important to me must be spoken, made verbal and shared, even at the risk of having it bruised or misunderstood." -- Audre Lorde

item.title: Oscar add a quote by Derek Walcott
item.description: "Break a vase, and the love that reassembles the fragments is stronger than that love which took its symmetry for granted when it was whole." -- Derek Walcott

item.title: Oscar add a quote by Martin Espada
item.description: "A poem is not a pop-tart." -- Martin Espada

item.title: Oscar add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Only the phoenix rises and does not descend. And everything changes. And nothing is truly lost." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Oscar add a quote by Bob Kaufman
item.description: "Streets paved with opal sadness, Lead me counterclockwise, to pockets of joy, And jazz." -- Bob Kaufman

item.title: Oscar add a quote by Victor Hernández Cruz
item.description: "Migration is the story of my body" -- Victor Hernández Cruz

item.title: Oscar add a quote by Honoré de Balzac
item.description: "While seeking out the dead, I see nothing but the living." -- Honoré de Balzac

item.title: Oscar add a quote by Claribel Alegría
item.description: "Yo, poeta de oficio, condenada tantas veces" -- Claribel Alegría

item.title: Oscar add a quote by Kanye West
item.description: "Sometimes when I see a bad performance and people still clap... I wonder if they're clapping because they liked what they saw or because they're happy it's over?" -- Kanye West

item.title: Oscar add a quote by William Carlos Williams
item.description: "We sit and talk quietly, with long lapses of silence, and I am aware of the stream that has no language, coursing beneath the quiet heaven of your eyes, which has no speech." -- William Carlos Williams

item.title: Oscar add a quote by Bertolt Brecht
item.description: "Art is not a mirror held up to reality but a hammer with which to shape it." -- Bertolt Brecht

item.title: Oscar add a quote by Eduardo Galeano
item.description: "Utopia lies at the horizon. When I draw nearer by two steps, it retreats two steps. If I proceed ten steps forward, it swiftly slips ten steps ahead. No matter how far I go, I can never reach it. What, then, is the purpose of utopia? It is to cause us to advance." -- Eduardo Galeano

item.title: Oscar add a quote by Eduardo Hughes Galeano
item.description:
"Si le niegan la boca, ella habla por las manos, o por los ojos, o por los poros, o por donde sea.
Porque todos, toditos tenemos algo que decir a los demas; alguna cosa que merece ser por los demas celebrada, o perdonada." -- Eduardo Hughes Galeano
